intro: Adenostemma lavenia var. parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered adenostemma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale purple or white, arranged in spikes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassy areas or disturbed sites. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
